result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathleen R Bullis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course and a parenting course.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kathleen R Bullis in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kathleen R Bullis in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 2:
  Defendant  advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 3:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 3 DISMISSED and READ IN.

    Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 85 days. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.   
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-30 days in the House of Correction with release for child care, work, school, AODA treatment, Mental Health treatment, medical treatment and any programming she may be participating in throught the Day Reporting Center
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Successfully complete a parenting course
-No contact with Donald A
-6 month drivers license suspension consecutive
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/22/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/22/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Kathleen R Bullis in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kathleen R Bullis in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant waives speedy trial demand. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/22/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15. Court vacates trial date.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Kathleen R Bullis not in court, in custody. Nick Cerwin for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 6/1/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 6/22/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Kathleen R Bullis not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for STATUS on 4/29/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15. Court has pre-selected a trial date within the speedy trial time frame.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Kathleen R Bullis in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kathleen R Bullis in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Kathleen R Bullis in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  
Defendant Kathleen R Bullis in custody.  
Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kathleen R Bullis
Current: 5166 N 63rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 03-14-2015)
Prior: 5155 N 63rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
